articles.title: Keine Waffen an Ukraine – „Das war richtig und das bleibt richtig“
articles.image_title: FILE - German Chancellor Olaf Scholz leaves after a news conference, ahead of a one-day closed meeting of the German Cabinet at the Chancellery in Berlin, Germany, Friday, Jan. 21, 2022. Scholz is flying to Washington this week to reassure Americans that his country stands alongside the United States and other NATO partners in opposing any Russian aggression against Ukraine. Scholz has publicly said that Moscow would pay a ‚Äúhigh price‚Äù in the event of an attack. But his government‚Äôs refusal to supply lethal weapons to Ukraine, bolster its troop presence in eastern Europe or spell out which sanctions it would support against Russia has drawn criticism abroad and at home. (Michael Kappeler/Pool via AP, File)
